BREAKING NEWS: Groom FFA was awarded a $1200 "Living to Serve" grant through National FFA! Our grant focuses on contributing to end hunger in our community. Students taking the Principles Class are building self-wicking garden beds to grow short season vegetables. The vegetables will then be donated to the Groom Helping Hands Food Pantry and the Meals on Wheels program. Groom FFA President, Mallie Williams, provided essential leadership with this endeavor as she helped write and edit the grant that will help sustain the program. Look for more info on our progress over the coming weeks! #TheG

8 Groom ISD High School students completed and passed the ServSafe Manager certification as taught through the Food Science Ag class. The ServSafe Manager Certification verifies that a manager or person-in-charge has sufficient food safety knowledge to protect the public from foodborne illness. ... The ServSafe Manager Certification is accredited by the American National Standards Institute (ANSI) under the Conference for Food Protection Standards.

This was not an easy certification to obtain, and students had to work hard. This certification will allow them to be more knowledgeable, skilled employees. Way to go!! #TheG
